parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.62

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Mods and Addons

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns list of mod parameters according to given options, values are in same order as the given options. Available options are:
{<template><title>!</title></template> style<template><title>=</title></template>"border-spacing: 1.5em 0"
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"name"</tt>			<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> name to be shown (Arma 3 instead of A3, etc.)
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"picture"</tt>		<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> picture shown in Mod Launcher
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"logo"</tt>			<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> logo to be shown in Main Menu
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"logoOver"</tt>		<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> logo to be shown in Main Menu when mouse is over
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"logoSmall"</tt>		<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> small version of logo, prepared for drawing small icons
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"tooltip"</tt>		<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> tooltip to be shown on mouse over 
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"tooltipOwned"</tt>	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> tooltip to be shown on mouse over the icon when DLC is owned by player
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"action"</tt>			<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> url to be triggered when mod button is clicked
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"actionName"</tt>		<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> what to put on Action Button
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"overview"</tt>		<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[String]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> overview text visible in expansion menu
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"hidePicture"</tt>	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[Boolean]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> do not show mod picture icon in the main menu mod list
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"hideName"</tt>		<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[Boolean]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> do not show mod name in the main menu mod list
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"defaultMod"</tt>		<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[Boolean]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> default mods cannot be moved or disabled by Mod Launcher
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"serverOnly"</tt>		<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[Boolean]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> mod doesn't have to be installed on client in order to play on server with this mod running
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>-
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template> <tt>"active"</tt>			<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> [[Boolean]]	<template><title>!</title></template><template><title>!</title></template> active mod (activated through command line or stored in profile by mod launcher)
<template lineStart="1"><title>!</title></template>}
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Please note that <tt>"active"</tt> does not actually tell you if a mod is running / pretends to be running.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[modParams]] [modClass, options]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [modClass, options]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> modClass: [[String]] - class name of the mod

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> options: [[Array]] - see description

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - retrieved requested data on success or empty array []

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_data = [[modParams]] ["Kart", ["name", "logo", "picture"]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[configSourceModList]], [[configSourceMod]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- BEGIN Note Section -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 24, 2017 - 21:25 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">This command used to spam .[[rpt]] when queried mod didn't exist, making it little awkward to use for testing if mod is active. For example: 
<code>_superDuperModEnabled = [[modParams]] ["super_duper", ["active"]] [[param]] [0, [[false]]];</code>
Since v1.69 the command would fail silently if mod didn't exist, but would still log .rpt error if the mod name passed to the command was empty or there was an error processing one of the passed options.
</dd>

<comment><!-- END Note Section -->
</comment></dl>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]


<dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 26, 2021 - 16:42 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:heyoxe|heyoxe]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
For each value, it will first read the value from the <tt>mod.cpp</tt> file, if the value is not in it (or the files does not exist), it will try to read it from the <tt>CfgMods</tt> entry as long as it has the EXACT same name. If you try to get <tt>"name"</tt> and the command cannot find it in either of those locations, it will return the same value as the <tt>modClass</tt> input.<br>
In practice, this means that content from user mods will always be read from <tt>mod.cpp</tt> and never from the <tt>CfgMods</tt>.
</dd>
</dl></root>
